publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-631 Mr Brian Monteith: Competitive Football for Under 12s—That the Parliament believes that children of 12 years and under should be able to enjoy the same rights as older children to participate in competitive football tournaments through schools, boys’ and girls’ clubs; calls upon the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to institute a consultation exercise with young children to establish their views; urges the SFA to strike a better balance between skill, physical fitness, mental attitude and enjoyment by reversing its policy to introduce a ban on competitive tournaments for under 12s, and further urges the SFA to lobby UEFA to ensure that their current recommendation against such competitive tournaments is not made mandatory through an enforceable directive.
S1M-631 Competitive Football for Under 12s (lodged on 3 March 2000) Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-631 Competitive Football for Under 12s (lodged on 3 March 2000) Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-631 Mr Brian Monteith: Competitive Football for Under 12s—That the Parliament believes that children of 12 years and under should be able to enjoy the same rights as older children to participate in competitive football tournaments through schools, boys’ and girls’ clubs; calls upon the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to institute a consultation exercise with young children to establish their views; urges the SFA to strike a better balance between skill, physical fitness, mental attitude and enjoyment by reversing its policy to introduce a ban on competitive tournaments for under 12s and further urges the SFA to lobby UEFA to ensure that their current recommendation against such competitive tournaments is not made mandatory through an enforceable directive. Supported by: Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Keith Harding, David McLetchie*

S1M-631 Mr Brian Monteith: Competitive Football for Under 12s—That the Parliament believes that children of 12 years and under should be able to enjoy the same rights as older children to participate in competitive football tournaments through schools, boys’ and girls’ clubs; calls upon the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to institute a consultation exercise with young children to establish their views; urges the SFA to strike a better balance between skill, physical fitness, mental attitude and enjoyment by reversing its policy to introduce a ban on competitive tournaments for under 12s and further urges the SFA to lobby UEFA to ensure that their current recommendation against such competitive tournaments is not made mandatory through an enforceable directive. Supported by: Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Keith Harding, David McLetchie

S1M-631 Mr Brian Monteith: Competitive Football for Under 12s—That the Parliament believes that children of 12 years and under should be able to enjoy the same rights as older children to participate in competitive football tournaments through schools, boys’ and girls’ clubs; calls upon the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to institute a consultation exercise with young children to establish their views; urges the SFA to strike a better balance between skill, physical fitness, mental attitude and enjoyment by reversing its policy to introduce a ban on competitive tournaments for under 12s and further urges the SFA to lobby UEFA to ensure that their current recommendation against such competitive tournaments is not made mandatory through an enforceable directive. Supported by: Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Keith Harding, David McLetchie, Phil Gallie*
